result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl D Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11-30-15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. Cash bail applied.
Release for Mental Health treatment. Defendant to report on 09-08-15 by 12pm

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl D Price

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Carl D Price in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court orders the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with release for mental health treatment with credit for 11 days time served.
Defendant to report on 9/8/15 by 12pm 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 11.30.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.30.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Sentencing Referral Form.

JusticePoint Violation Report (7-22-15 missed office contact), filed. 

*Branch 07 in jury trial/violation not addressed, defendant not present*
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report, received and filed.  Court takes no action defendant to be tested again on 7.15.15.

Defendant Carl D Price in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Carl D Price in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.    Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Carl D Price in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for further negotiations.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM024725  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-14-15

Defendant Carl D Price in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Carl D Price in custody.  Hanna Kolberg for Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is reassigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07due to the charges in this criminal complaint.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Carl D Price in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Carl D Price in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
